What is the purpose of the Verus DeFi protocol in relation to liquidity pools and currency conversions?

The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions using a particular liquidity pool and mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing problems like miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running. It also provides fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.

ies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.
## Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches
 - Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockchain, and all fees generated via cross chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity.
## Blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds, including for dual launches (blockchain and bridge)
- Set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on chain. If by the start time of your blockchain, minimums are not met, all participants will automatically get a refund of all of their pre-conversions, less the network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies, similarly price neutral carve-outs

How do simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches work with Verus?

With Verus, it is possible to launch a new blockchain and a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool simultaneously. The bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset-backed or partially asset-backed currencies, but are bound to the launch of the new blockchain and run on it. All fees generated via cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain, with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, providing seamless connectivity.

What is the purpose of setting minimum participation levels for crowdfunding currency launches with Verus?

With Verus, you can set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on-chain. If the minimums are not met by the start time of your blockchain, all participants will automatically get a refund of all their pre-conversions, less the network fees. This ensures that currency launches are successful and that participants are not left with incomplete or failed launches.

What additional launch options are available for crowdfunding currency launches with Verus?

Verus provides additional launch options, including the ability to set maximum participation in one or more currencies, offer pre-launch discounts, and make price-neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies. Additionally, price-neutral carve-outs are also available, providing flexibility and control over the launch process.
